text: Tellis Burthorne Ellis Jr. (26 May 1912 – 15 March 2000) was an American football and basketball coach. He was the head football coach at Jackson State University in Jackson, Mississippi. He led the Tigers to a 24–21–3 record from 1946 to 1951 before being replaced by future College Football Hall of Fame coach John Merritt. He was educated at Morehouse College and Boston University. A gymnasium and the football training facility on JSU's campus are named in his honor. ==References== Category:1912 births Category:2000 deaths Category:Basketball coaches from Mississippi Category:Jackson State Tigers and Lady Tigers athletic directors Category:Jackson State Tigers football coaches Category:Jackson State Tigers basketball coaches Category:Morehouse College alumni Category:Boston University alumni Category:People from Vicksburg, Mississippi
title: T. B. Ellis
